name: Tea Leaf Eggs
author: jilloon
summary: It may not sound edible, but trust me, once you start, you can't stop! The best part about the recipe, is that you can just leave the eggs alone, and they still come out perfect.
directions: Place the tea, cinnamon, star anise, five-spice, cloves, ginger, peppercorns, licorice, orange peel, rock sugar, dark soy sauce, and light soy sauce in a large saucepan
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and let simmer for 15 minutes
Meanwhile, lightly tap the hard-cooked eggs to crack the shells all over
The soy sauce will penetrate the cracks, and color the egg white
Place the eggs in the simmering liquid, and cook for 30 minutes, then remove from the heat, and let the eggs stand in the liquid for 2 hours off the heat
After 2 hours, drain the eggs, chill, and peel
